thread.title: Hillary Clinton Has Won the Benghazi Hearing
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton Has Won the Benghazi Hearing

author: Lyzza
title: Hillary Clinton Has Won the Benghazi Hearing
text: Hillary Clinton Has Won the Benghazi Hearing Too funny. Good job girl. What a waste of time, and our money Location: Texas. Posts: 29,006 I wonder when they taped the different hearings so they could broadcast the different hearings to different outlets. Quote: Originally Posted by Jimmyb I wonder when they taped the different hearings so they could broadcast the different hearings to different outlets. Zing! Quote: Originally Posted by Jimmyb I wonder when they taped the different hearings so they could broadcast the different hearings to different outlets. Please explain. Originally Posted by Lyzza Too funny. Good job girl. What a waste of time, and our money As I said, if they continue to take her on by creating a scandal that has no basis in fact, they will inherit a war, which will cost them credibility in the end. She is a seasoned attorney, executive officer, and diplomat. Did they think she would break down and cry? How mysoganistic are these clowns? And apparently politically dense to boot. Thanks from Camelot , LongWinded and Lyzza Quote: Originally Posted by Asimov As I said, if they continue to take her on by creating a scandal that has no basis in fact, they will inherit a war, which will cost them credibility in the end. She is a seasoned attorney, executive officer, and diplomat. Did they think she would break down and cry? How mysoganistic are these clowns? And apparently politically dense to boot. It's all a smoke screen. Originally Posted by imaginethat Please explain. There will be three starkly different opinions on how the hearing went: the left's the right's, and a reasonable assessment based on the purpose of the hearing. The differing views will be as if three different hearings were watched by each group rather than all watching the same hearing. There was no bombshell expected from the hearing by Gowdy. He is a former federal prosecutor the 7th Circuit Solicitor. This was a deposition and the questions and answers, at this juncture, were based on information he already has. Depositions can be fact finding and they can also put contradictions from past statements in the record and and testimony contrary to the facts in the record. It's just a piece of the puzzle. Quote: Originally Posted by Jimmyb There will be three starkly different opinions on how the hearing went: the left's the right's, and a reasonable assessment based on the purpose of the hearing. The differing views will be as if three different hearings were watched by each group rather than all watching the same hearing. There was no bombshell expected from the hearing by Gowdy. He is a former federal prosecutor the 7th Circuit Solicitor. This was a deposition and the questions and answers, at this juncture, were based on information he already has. Depositions can be fact finding and they can also put contradictions from past statements in the record and and testimony contrary to the facts in the record. It's just a piece of the puzzle. Gotcha, thanks, and agreed. I don't like Hillary. Even so, she won. To the average person this session looked like a prosecution ring rather than an investigative committee.
